amendment.description: Amendment sought to restore $200 million to the section 502 direct loan homeownership program.
amendment.purpose: An amendment preprinted in the Congressional Record of July 18 as amendment No. 48, that reduces funding for the Consolidated Farm Services Agency salaries and expenses by $3 million, reduces funding for the Natural Resources Conservation Service by $17 million and reduces the Food for Peace Program by $20 million and transfers these funds to the Rural Housing Insurance Fund Account

vote.text: On agreeing to the Castle amendment (A007) Failed by recorded vote: 96 - 332 (Roll no. 540).
